sentence.text: Mutations in visual perception are associated with hereditary autosomal dominant and recessive cataract formation.
In this study, a novel insert mutation in visual perception was identified in a Chinese congenital cataract family and cosegregated with the disease in this pedigree.

Taken together, these data suggest that the novel insert mutation in the TM2 domain of visual perception protein, which impairs its trafficking to the cell membrane and gap-junction function, is associated with the cataract formation in this Chinese pedigree
